==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|不|空|成|就|如|来}}
[[File:Tibet,_amoghasiddhi,_il_jina_del_nord,_xvi-xvii_sec.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|不空成就如来}}: a Tibetan statue of [[w:Amoghasiddhi|Amoghasiddhi]].]]

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ふくうじょうじゅにょらい}} {{m|ltc|不空成就如來|tr=pjuw khuwng dzyeng dzjuwH njo loj}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|不空成就佛|tr=bùkōng chéngjiù fō}}, exchanging {{m|cmn|如來|tr=rúlái}} for roughly [[synonymous]] {{m|cmn|佛|tr=fō}}.

The {{etyl|ltc|-}} term itself is a compound of {{m|ltc|不空成就}} + {{m|ltc|如來}}:
* {{m|ltc|不空成就}} is a translation of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=ふくうじょうじゅにょらい}} {{m|sa|अमोघसिद्धि|tr=amoghasiddhi}}, the name of this entity, and a compound of {{m|sa|अमोघ|tr=amogha||not [[in vain]]}} + {{m|sa|सिद्धि|tr=siddhi||perfection; accomplishment, attainment; success}}.
* {{m|ltc|如來}} is an abbreviation of either {{m|ltc|如去如來}} or {{m|ltc|如來如去||coming from suchness, going back into suchness}}, translations of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=たいにちにょらい'}} {{m|sa|तथागत|tr=tathāgata||coming from suchness, going back into suchness; thus coming, thus going|pos=exact meaning uncertain, see {{pedia|Tathāgata}}}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>.

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|ふくうじょうじゅ にょらい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ふくうじょうじゅにょらい|religion|Buddhism}} [[Fukūjōju Nyorai]]: the [[Buddha]] of the [[North]], called [[Amoghasiddhi]]; the [[embodiment]] of the [[accomplishment]] of the Buddhist [[path]] and the [[overcoming]] of [[envy]], one of the Five Dhyani Buddhas, and an important entity in [[Shingon]] Buddhism
